title: Fix footer settings error and admin panel mobile issues

requirements.summary: Fix the error that occurs when opening footer settings in the admin panel
acceptanceCriteria: Footer settings tab in admin panel opens without errors
All footer management functionality is accessible
Console shows no errors when accessing footer settings

file_operations.description: Debug and fix the error occurring when the footer settings tab is opened. Common issues to check: missing null/undefined checks for footer data properties, incorrect data access patterns, missing error boundaries, improper array handling for sections or quick links, and issues with drag-and-drop state management. Ensure all footer content fields (contact, sections, quickLinks, copyright) are safely accessed with optional chaining or null checks before rendering.

Add error boundary or try-catch handling around the Footer tab content to gracefully handle any errors in FooterManager and display a helpful error message instead of crashing. Ensure tab switching to Footer does not cause the entire admin panel to become unusable.

requirements.summary: Make footer section headings consistent with the rest of the UI styling and typography
acceptanceCriteria: Footer section headings use the same font family, weight, and sizing as other UI headings
Footer section heading colors match the theme color scheme
Spacing and margins around footer headings are consistent with other sections

file_operations.description: Update footer section heading styles to match the global heading design system. Apply consistent font family, weight (likely font-semibold or font-bold), and sizing classes (e.g., text-lg or text-xl) that match headings in other sections like Overview, Services, or Clinics. Ensure heading colors use theme variables (e.g., text-foreground or text-primary) and spacing (margin-bottom) is consistent with other section headings throughout the application.

Review and ensure global heading styles are properly defined and applicable to footer headings. If footer headings need special targeting, consider adding a CSS rule that ensures .footer h2, .footer h3 classes inherit from the global heading styles. Verify theme color variables are correctly applied for both light and dark modes.

requirements.summary: Fix the admin panel settings menu layout in mobile mode to prevent crowding and overlapping of section options
acceptanceCriteria: All admin panel tabs are fully visible and accessible on mobile screens
Tab labels do not overlap or get cut off
Navigation between settings sections works smoothly on mobile devices
Layout adapts properly to different mobile screen sizes

file_operations.description: Fix the mobile layout of the admin panel tabs to prevent crowding and overlapping. Implement responsive design strategies: (1) Use Tailwind responsive classes to make tabs scrollable horizontally on mobile (e.g., add overflow-x-auto and flex-nowrap to the tabs list), (2) Reduce tab padding and font size on small screens using responsive utilities like sm:px-4 px-2 and sm:text-base text-sm, (3) Consider using a dropdown/select menu for tab navigation on mobile screens (below md breakpoint), or (4) Stack tabs vertically on very small screens. Ensure the TabsList component from shadcn/ui is wrapped with appropriate responsive container classes and test on various mobile viewport sizes (320px, 375px, 414px).
